_header: Young and lusty though ye be
_description: On the faithlessness of women — two stanzas rhyme royal

BLSl1825.First Lines:
yong and lusty thowgh ye beAnd sum tyme stode in
                    grace…
BLSl1825.Last Lines:
…So ys yowre lady thatt was sum tymeAs trew and stabyll as was
                    the wynde
BLSl1825.Note:
Added to MS flyleaf by a fifteenth-century hand. Title or motto beneath
                    and to right: ‘Envye wyll he’; follows 4250 on same leaf but written by a different hand;
                    precedes 2427 which is by same
                    hand as 4250.
